intro: Piriqueta hapala, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Piriqueta hapala plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is a symbol of Hawaiian botanical diversity.
